qas.question: It is believed that animals evolved from what?
What are the closest known living relatives of animals?
What is the name of the supergroup that animals have been placed in by molecular studies?
The opisthokonts also include what other organisms?

answers.text: choanoflagellates, fungi and a few small parasitic protists

qas.question: Where does the name opisthokonts come from?

answers.text: the posterior location of the flagellum in motile cells

context: Animals are generally considered to have evolved from <a0_0>a flagellated eukaryote<a0_0/>. Their closest known living relatives are the <a1_0>choanoflagellates<a1_0/>, collared flagellates that have a morphology similar to the choanocytes of certain sponges. Molecular studies place animals in a supergroup called the <a2_0>opisthokonts<a2_0/>, which also include the <a3_0>choanoflagellates, fungi and a few small parasitic protists<a3_0/>. The name comes from <a4_0>the posterior location of the flagellum in motile cells<a4_0/>, such as most animal spermatozoa, whereas other eukaryotes tend to have anterior flagella.
